title: Failed to run on Ubuntu python3.7 and python3.8
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

<!-- Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System:Ubuntu20.04
*   Python Version Used:python3
*   When you install doccano:today
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc):pip install
*Failed to run in python3.7
Setup Database.
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/mingzhu/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/app/manage.py", line 15, in <module>
    execute_from_command_line(sys.argv)
  File "/home/mingzhu/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 381, in execute_from_command_line
    utility.execute()
  File "/home/mingzhu/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 325, in execute
    settings.INSTALLED_APPS
  File "/home/mingzhu/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/conf/__init__.py", line 79, in __getattr__
    self._setup(name)
  File "/home/mingzhu/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/conf/__init__.py", line 66, in _setup
    self._wrapped = Settings(settings_module)
  File "/home/mingzhu/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/conf/__init__.py", line 157, in __init__
    mod = importlib.import_module(self.SETTINGS_MODULE)
  File "/home/mingzhu/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/importlib/__init__.py", line 127, in import_module
    return _bootstrap._gcd_import(name[level:], package, level)

             ^
